content.question: Which of the following best explains a limitation of the data in the maps?

choices.label: Most of the people older than 65 in 1982 lived near the coast, but the 2010 map does not show where those people now live.
The maps show different populations at different times, so the data are not directly comparable.
The demographic problem of an aging population is dynamic, but the maps only capture two points in time.
It is inaccurate to compare these two time periods because the population of China increased significantly between 1982 and 2010.

content.answer: The demographic problem of an aging population is dynamic, but the maps only capture two points in time.
